intro: Anemonanthea apennina, commonly known as the Italian anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Anemonanthea apennina is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and early spring blooms.
